title: Fix login timeout handling
body:
## Problem

The login handler does not respect the configured timeout value. When a user's session takes longer than expected, the system hangs indefinitely instead of timing out.

## Expected Behavior

The login handler should:
1. Use the timeout value from the configuration
2. Return a `408 Request Timeout` if the login takes too long
3. Log the timeout event for debugging

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Set `LOGIN_TIMEOUT=5000` in config
2. Simulate a slow authentication backend (>5s response)
3. Observe that the login request never times out

## Additional Context

This affects both the REST API and the GraphQL mutation. The timeout logic was removed in PR #35 as part of a refactor.

comments.author: maintainer-1
comments.body: Confirmed. The timeout was accidentally removed. We should also add a test for this.

comments.author: developer-2
comments.body: I think the timeout should be configurable per-route, not just globally.
